intro: Boehmeria robusta, commonly known as Chinese nettle or wild hemp, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its stout, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, and its fibers are used in traditional textile production. Boehmeria robusta thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
